name: breast cancer prediction classification
description: The features that have been computed from digitized images of the cell nuclei which can be used to build a model to predict whether a tumor is benign or malignant. REMOVING CORRELATED FEATURES MAY INCREASE ACCURACY APPLYING FEATURE SCALING MAY IMPROVE ACCURACY APPLYING MODELS THERE WAS A TIE BETWEEN RANDOM FOREST AND KERNEL SVM WITH AN ACCURACY OF 98. 1 Malignant Cancerous Present M 0 Benign Not Cancerous Absent B NO MISSING DATA WE CAN EITHER REMOVE THE HIGH CORRELATED FEATURES OR WE CAN USE ALL THE FEATURES I AM USING ALL FEATURES. PREDICTING BREAST CANCER USING VARIOUS CLASSIFICATION MODELS.
